poem:
Title: "An Ode to Chicken Wings and Potatoes"

Wings of chicken, an air fryer's delight,
potatoes play sibling at this table of flight.
Cheap, quick, confident in hand,
a simple fare, yet grand.
Perched on the sofa, an intimate sight,
Elemental delight in every bite.
The humble bird, the earth-born sphere,
In unity uncluttered, my dear,
tossed in the dance of life's great band.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Honey & Co’s air-fryer chicken wings with baby potatoes – recipe Chicken and chips! Our new air fryer version of this timeless dinner has become a favourite. Chicken wings are cheap, they cook quickly (especially in an air fryer) and are full of flavour. They’re also the only part of the bird that can be confidently eaten while perched on the sofa (our dining position of choice). The small potatoes here get tossed in all". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
